meals.dish_name: Lemon Garlic Roasted Chicken with Quinoa and Salad
meals.description: A high-protein, fiber-rich meal utilizing BOGO chicken and quinoa. It provides lean protein and essential vitamins from fresh greens.
recipe: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Season chicken breasts with garlic powder, salt, pepper, and a squeeze of lemon.
Roast chicken for 20-25 minutes until internal temperature reaches 165°F.
While chicken roasts, prepare the Quinoa & Rice according to package instructions.
Toss the salad blends with a light dressing of olive oil and lemon.
Slice chicken and serve over a bed of quinoa with the salad on the side.

meals.description: A heart-healthy seafood dish using low-carb, high-fiber pasta and protein-packed shrimp. Mushrooms and spinach add volume and antioxidants while keeping the meal light.
ingredients: Fresh Express Salad Blends (Spinach or Greens)
recipe: Boil a large pot of water and cook the Carbe Diem! pasta according to package directions.
In a large skillet, sauté sliced mushrooms in olive oil until browned.
Add the shrimp and garlic powder to the skillet, cooking until shrimp are pink and opaque (about 3-4 minutes).
Stir in the pasta sauce and a handful of fresh greens, simmering until the greens wilt.
Drain the pasta and toss it directly into the skillet with the shrimp and sauce mixture.
Serve hot, optionally topped with a squeeze of fresh lemon.

meals.description: A comforting, nutrient-dense stew utilizing lean ground beef and mineral-rich bone broth. This one-pot meal is packed with fiber from root vegetables.
recipe: In a large pot, brown the ground beef over medium heat and drain any excess fat.
Add chopped onions, carrots, and celery; cook until the onions are translucent (about 5-7 minutes).
Pour in the bone broth and add the cubed red potatoes.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes until the potatoes and carrots are fork-tender.
Season with salt, pepper, and herbs to taste before serving in bowls.

meals.dish_name: Saffron Yellow Rice with Roasted Asparagus and Chicken Sausage
meals.description: A quick, balanced meal featuring lean chicken sausage and flavorful rice. Asparagus provides high levels of vitamins K and A for a healthy nutritional profile.
recipe: Prepare the Saffron Yellow Rice on the stovetop as directed on the package (usually takes 20-25 minutes).
Toss the asparagus spears in olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Roast the asparagus at 400°F (200°C) for 12-15 minutes until tender-crisp.
While asparagus roasts, brown the chicken sausage bites in a skillet for 5-7 minutes until heated through.
Serve the sausage and roasted asparagus over a warm bed of saffron rice.
